rules.natural: If the curator has approval for the exhibition plan, then the exhibition opens successfully.
If the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.
Either the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture or the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets.
If the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.
If the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools, then the technician completes lighting in the gallery space.
If the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space, then the exhibition opens successfully.
If the project manager coordinates teams, then the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools.
If the senior designer supervises installation, then the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space.
Either the project manager holds a meeting with team leads or the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space.
If the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space, then the senior designer supervises installation.
If the curator submits a request to the director, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.
Either the curator submits a request to the director or the curator presents a proposal to the board.
If the public receives a complaint about accessibility, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.
Either the public receives a complaint about accessibility or the inspector identifies safety hazards.
If the inspector identifies safety hazards, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.
If the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.
If the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items, then the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items.
If the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement, then the director approves the loan agreement contract.
Either the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement or the curator negotiates terms with lenders.
If the curator negotiates terms with lenders, then the curator signing contracts with lenders leads to the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.
If the director approves the loan agreement contract, then the curator signing contracts with lenders causes the curator to have approval for the exhibition plan.
If the curator presents a proposal to the board, then the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan.
If the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan, then the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget.
If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items.
If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the curator signs contracts with lenders.
If the security head verifies compliance with the exhibition plan, then the curator obtaining funding for the exhibition budget results in the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.
If the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew, then the director extending the deadline for the setup period leads to the director not canceling the exhibition.
If the project manager holding a meeting with team leads does not result in the project manager coordinating teams, then the exhibition misses its opening.
If the exhibition does not open successfully, then the director cancels the exhibition.

The technician does not complete lighting in the gallery space.

(A1 → G).natural: If the curator has approval for the exhibition plan, then the exhibition opens successfully.

(A10 → A9).natural: If the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture or the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets.

(A11 → A9).natural: If the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.

(A12 ∨ G).natural: Either the technician completes lighting in the gallery space or the exhibition opens successfully.

(A13 → A12).natural: If the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools, then the technician completes lighting in the gallery space.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools or the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space.

(A14 → G).natural: If the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space, then the exhibition opens successfully.

(A15 → A13).natural: If the project manager coordinates teams, then the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Either the project manager coordinates teams or the senior designer supervises installation.

(A16 → A14).natural: If the senior designer supervises installation, then the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space.

(A17 → A15).natural: If the project manager holds a meeting with team leads, then the project manager coordinates teams.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either the project manager holds a meeting with team leads or the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space.

(A18 → A16).natural: If the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space, then the senior designer supervises installation.

(A2 → A1).natural: If the curator submits a request to the director, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Either the curator submits a request to the director or the curator presents a proposal to the board.

(A20 → ¬A19).natural: If the public receives a complaint about accessibility, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: Either the public receives a complaint about accessibility or the inspector identifies safety hazards.

(A21 → ¬A19).natural: If the inspector identifies safety hazards, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.

(A22 → A1).natural: If the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A23 → A22).natural: If the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items, then the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items.

(A24 → A1).natural: If the curator signs contracts with lenders, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A25 → (A24 → A1)).natural: If the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement, then the curator signing contracts with lenders results in the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.

(A25 → A27).natural: If the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement, then the director approves the loan agreement contract.

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement or the curator negotiates terms with lenders.

(A26 → (A24 → A1)).natural: If the curator negotiates terms with lenders, then the curator signing contracts with lenders leads to the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.

(A27 → (A24 → A1)).natural: If the director approves the loan agreement contract, then the curator signing contracts with lenders causes the curator to have approval for the exhibition plan.

(A3 → A1).natural: If the curator presents a proposal to the board, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A3 → A4).natural: If the curator presents a proposal to the board, then the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan.

(A4 → A1).natural: If the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A4 → A5).natural: If the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan, then the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget.

(A5 → A1).natural: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.

(A5 → A22).natural: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items.

(A5 → A23).natural: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items.

(A5 → A24).natural: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the curator signs contracts with lenders.

(A6 → (A5 → A1)).natural: If the security head verifies compliance with the exhibition plan, then the curator obtaining funding for the exhibition budget results in the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.

(A8 → ¬A7).natural: If the director extends the deadline for the setup period, then the director does not cancel the exhibition.

(A9 → (A8 → ¬A7)).natural: If the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew, then the director extending the deadline for the setup period leads to the director not canceling the exhibition.

(¬(A17 → A15) → A19).natural: If the project manager holding a meeting with team leads does not result in the project manager coordinating teams, then the exhibition misses its opening.
